messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Juyo tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, Comparing it to the Yamakichi tsuba that are already Juyo I doubt that it will make it, even though it is a very well known, published piece. Jim
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
Comparing it to the Yamakichi tsuba that are already Juyo I doubt that it
will make it, even though it is a very well known, published piece.


Jim




> I'd imagine the finest Kinko, Goto and other heavily golderated ( I
> know, it's a great word ) works would. I also assume the finest of
> Sukashi could. I have also wondered about this little gem.
>
> http://ginzaseikodo.com/yamakichi.html
>
> Priced at 3 million yen, I think it would want to be Juyo LOL. What are
> the groups thought's on this
>
> Another thought, I have seen several good pieces put up for Tokubetsu
> Hozon bounced recently and I think that Kodogu shinsa is a tough game
> for many of us, so know your hobby I think.............. agghhh, but the
> thrill of the chase eh !!!!!
>
> cheers
>
> Rich
>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Juyo tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Hi: Well for 3,000,000 JPY there are a lot of fine things out there, but I don t think that is one of them. Of course it all boils down to supply and demand
messages.messageBody:
Hi:
Well for 3,000,000 JPY there are a lot of fine things out there, but I don't think that is one of them. Of course it all boils down to supply and demand and Yamakichibei are admired, but that one looks very pedestrian to me. Just my two cents worth.
AF



>>> ikkanshi@... 09/01/05 2:42 AM >>>
I'd imagine the finest Kinko, Goto and other heavily golderated ( I
know, it's a great word ) works would. I also assume the finest of
Sukashi could. I have also wondered about this little gem.

http://ginzaseikodo.com/yamakichi.html

Priced at 3 million yen, I think it would want to be Juyo LOL. What are
the groups thought's on this

Another thought, I have seen several good pieces put up for Tokubetsu
Hozon bounced recently and I think that Kodogu shinsa is a tough game
for many of us, so know your hobby I think.............. agghhh, but the
thrill of the chase eh !!!!!

cheers

Rich

>
>David Zincavage

messages.subject: Juyo tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: I am planning to submit a tsuba for NBTHK papers, and the question comes to mind: what does it take for a tsuba to make the Juyo grade?  (and can it possibly
messages.messageBody:
I am planning to submit a tsuba for NBTHK papers, and the question comes to
mind: what does it take for a tsuba to make the Juyo grade? (and can it
possibly be worth paying for higher level tsuba papers?)

David Zincavage
